{"step_by_step_thinking": "When the free way space of a complete denture is less than normal, it means that there is inadequate space between the upper and lower dentures during functional movements of the jaw. This can lead to several adverse effects. Mucosal irritation can occur due to the dentures rubbing against the soft tissues of the mouth. Irresistible alveolar ridge resorption refers to the gradual loss of bone in the area where the denture rests, which can happen when there is excessive pressure on the ridge. Nonspecific ulcerations can also occur due to the constant friction and pressure on the oral tissues. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Mucosal irritation.", "answer_choice": "A"}
